com.kontakt.sdk.android.ble.connection.ibeacon

Class IBeaconConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kontakt.sdk.android.ble.connection.ibeacon.IBeaconConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RemoteDeviceConnection<IBeaconDevice>

    public class IBeaconConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements RemoteDeviceConnection<IBeaconDevice>
    IBeacon connection allows to establish connection with beacon by authorizing it with its password and changing iBeacon parameters.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  IBeaconConnection.ConnectionListener 
      static class  IBeaconConnection.State
      State enum describes all possible state that BeaconConnection may be in.
      static interface  IBeaconConnection.WriteBatchListener<T>
      WriteBatchListener provides callback methods notifying about writing parameters batch to Beacon device.
      static interface  IBeaconConnection.WriteListener
      WriteListener provides callbacks indicating whether Beacon characteristics manipulation ended successfully or failed.

      • applyConfig

        public void applyConfig(Config config,
                        IBeaconConnection.WriteBatchListener<Config> writeBatchListener)
        Applies pending configuration (Config) for Beacon.

        * It is possible to encounter problems during batch (the Config in this case) write operation which result in launching error handle callback method. Once the write batch operation failes, the Write Batch Processor will attempt performing rollback write batch operation aiming at restoring original Beacon configuration. The rollback operation however may not succeed as well leaving Beacon device changed partially. Therefore it is strongly advisable to write batches in relatively close distance to Beacon device. Thus, the risk of leaving Beacon in unspecified state may be avoided. The method is synchronized.

        Parameters:
        config - the config
        writeBatchListener - the write batch listener

      • acceptProfile

        public void acceptProfile(Profile profile,
                          IBeaconConnection.WriteBatchListener<Profile> writeBatchListener)
        Accepts predefined profile (Profile) and changes parameters for Beacon.

        It is possible to encounter problems during batch (the Profile in this case) write operation which result in launching error handle callback method. Once the write batch operation failes, the Write Batch Processor will attempt performing rollback write batch operation aiming at restoring original Beacon configuration. The rollback operation however may not succeed as well leaving Beacon device changed partially. Therefore it is strongly advisable to write batches in relatively close distance to Beacon device. Thus, the risk of leaving Beacon in unspecified state may be avoided. The method is synchronized.

        Parameters:
        profile - the profile
        writeBatchListener - the write batch listener

      • overwriteMinor

        public void overwriteMinor(int value,
                           IBeaconConnection.WriteListener writeListener)
        Writes minor value. The method is synchronized.
        Parameters:
        value - the value
        writeListener - the write listener

      • enableNonConnectableMode

        public void enableNonConnectableMode(java.lang.String masterPassword,
                                     IBeaconConnection.WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes Beacon mode to non-connectable. During the non-connectable mode no connection can be established with the Beacon for about 20 minutes.

        The non-connectable mode is also enabled when authentication failure occured because of providing wrong password.

        Beacon Master Password can be obtained via REST Client. The result callback is invoked by WriteListener.

        For more information concerning Beacon master password, see BeaconCredentials model (DeviceCredentials) The method is synchronized.

        Parameters:
        masterPassword - the beacon master password
        writeListener - the write listener

      • overwriteMajor

        public void overwriteMajor(int value,
                           IBeaconConnection.WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes Beacon major value. The result callback is invoked by WriteListener. The method is synchronized.
        Parameters:
        value - new value
        writeListener - the write listener

      • overwriteProximity

        public void overwriteProximity(java.util.UUID proximity,
                               IBeaconConnection.WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes Beacon Proximity UUID value. The result callback is invoked by WriteListener. The method is synchronized.
        Parameters:
        proximity - the proximity UUID
        writeListener - the write listener

      • overwritePassword

        public void overwritePassword(java.lang.String newPassword,
                              IBeaconConnection.WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes beacon password. The password must be 4-byte long. For more information see kontakt.io Datasheet - version 2.0. The result callback is invoked by WriteListener. The method is synchronized.
        Parameters:
        newPassword - the new password
        writeListener - the write listener
        See Also:
        kontakt.io Beacon Datasheet - version 2.0

      • overwriteModelName

        public void overwriteModelName(java.lang.String newModelName,
                               IBeaconConnection.WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes Beacon model name. The name should be no longer than sequence of 15 bytes (15 ASCII characters). For more information see kontakt.io Datasheet - version 2.0. The result callback is invoked by WriteListener. The method is synchronized.
        Parameters:
        newModelName - the new model name
        writeListener - the write listener
        See Also:
        kontakt.io Beacon Datasheet - version 2.0

      • overwriteAdvertisingInterval

        public void overwriteAdvertisingInterval(long millis,
                                         IBeaconConnection.WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes Beacon advertising interval. The interval value is accepted in milliseconds and must be within [20 - 10240] ms range. The method is synchronized.
        Parameters:
        millis - the interval millis
        writeListener - the write listener

      • overwritePowerLevel

        public void overwritePowerLevel(int powerLevel,
                                IBeaconConnection.WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes Beacon power level. The Power level is described by 8 levels where 0 is the lowest (default) and 7 is the highest. For more information see kontakt.io Datasheet - version 2.0.

        The result callback is invoked by WriteListener. The method is synchronized.

        Parameters:
        powerLevel - the power level
        writeListener - the write listener
        See Also:
        kontakt.io Beacon Datasheet - version 2.0.

      • resetDevice

        public void resetDevice(IBeaconConnection.WriteListener writeListener)
        Resets device so that connection is established once again.

        For more information see kontakt.io Datasheet - version 2.0.

        The result callback is invoked by WriteListener. The method is synchronized.

        Parameters:
        writeListener - the write listener
        See Also:
        kontakt.io Beacon Datasheet - version 2.0.

      • enableDfuMode

        public void enableDfuMode(java.lang.String masterPassword,
                          IBeaconConnection.WriteListener writeListener)
        Enables dfu mode. The method is synchronized.
        Parameters:
        masterPassword - the master password
        writeListener - the write listener

      • restoreDefaultSettings

        public void restoreDefaultSettings(java.lang.String masterPassword,
                                   IBeaconConnection.WriteListener writeListener)
        Restores default Beacon settings. As an argument, 6-byte long Beacon master password must be provided. The master password can be obtained via API Client. The method is synchronized.
        Parameters:
        masterPassword - the master password
        writeListener - the write listener
        See Also:
        kontakt.io Beacon Datasheet - version 2.0.
